results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = one-half number of permutations of length n with exactly k rising or falling successions, for n >= 1, 0 <= k <= n-1. T(1,0) = 1 by convention.
comment: (1/2) times number of permutations of 12...n such that exactly k of the following occur: 12, 23, ..., (n-1)n, 21, 32, ..., n(n-1).
reference: F. N. David, M. G. Kendall and D. E. Barton, Symmetric Function and Allied Tables, Cambridge, 1966, p. 263.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
J. Riordan, A recurrence for permutations without rising or falling successions, Ann. Math. Statist. 36 (1965), 708-710.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n-1), n=1..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 11 2013
